algorithm_technique: Calculate initial value, then iterate to find maximum gain by reversing a subarray.
problem_summary_simple: Maximize array value by reversing one subarray, where value is sum of absolute differences between adjacent elements.
problem_summary_technical: Calculates initial sum of absolute differences, then greedily finds the maximum increase by considering reversals at endpoints and within the array.
key_insights: The problem can be solved by calculating the initial value and then finding the maximum possible increase.
The increase in value comes from changing the absolute differences at the boundaries of the reversed subarray.
The greedy approach focuses on maximizing the gain by considering the impact of reversing a subarray starting or ending at the array's boundaries.
